triples.name: Foundation model
triples.relevance: Foundation models are the core technology that the survey examines for robotics applications.

triples.name: Robotics
triples.relevance: Robotics is the primary application domain being surveyed in this paper.

triples.name: Deep learning
triples.relevance: Deep learning is the machine learning paradigm underlying foundation models discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Large language model
triples.relevance: Large language models are specifically discussed as foundation models applicable to robotics for code generation and reasoning.

triples.name: Vision-language-action model
triples.relevance: Vision-language models are highlighted as enabling open-vocabulary visual recognition for robot perception.

triples.name: Zero-shot learning
triples.relevance: Zero-shot learning is an emergent capability of foundation models that enables solving problems without specific training data.

triples.name: Computer vision
triples.relevance: Computer vision is a key component of robot perception discussed in the survey.

triples.name: Uncertainty quantification
triples.relevance: Uncertainty quantification is mentioned as a critical challenge in deploying foundation models in robotics.
